topics.body:
So I got done watching Mad Max (again) with my family. Both my parents were fans of the original and...they didn't like it that much. I think it was too far from the original for them.
In fact, I know the exact moment that threw them off;
!http://pop.h-cdn.co/assets/15/21/1431967859-madmax-guitar.gif!
It's funny to me, since I called it my favorite scene.

topics.body:
So apparently Nasa is looking at transforming the moon. . . It's different from terraforming.  Basically what they want to do is that it's not realistic to terraform the entire moon given our current capabilities, but rather what they are thinking of doing is creating a dome that people live in by using a smaller crater to form half it.

Basically less like scifi and more like:
!http://files.archinect.com/uploads/ai/aiu_chester_zoo_biodome_01x.jpg!

That would actually be a pretty good idea, because you could carry out local long term experiments on how to make the moon habitable as a whole.  If the moon ever does become habitable keep in mind we're not talking breathable atmosphere but rather cities in biodomes.

It could be how we get started on colonizing the solar system, scientific labs on the planets and moons dedicated to long term terraforming rather than getting all the shit there from earth.

If you're having a hard time envisioning what I mean:
!http://www.nss.org/settlement/moon/LunarColonyRawlings650.jpg!


Also apparently carbon emissions from cars will be cut by 90% by 2030 due to driverless cars and hybrid vehicles.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
